basicInfo.parentCompany: Independent (privately held; founded by Jamie Opalchuk; acquired CloudBlue from Ingram Micro in August 2025)
basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2006 by Jamie Opalchuk in Burlington, Ontario, Canada. One of the first green web hosting companies, powered by 100% renewable energy through Green-e certified renewable energy certificates. Operates in 15+ countries including US, UK, Australia, Germany. Acquired CloudBlue from Ingram Micro in August 2025. Focus on small-to-medium businesses with multilingual support.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: 30-day full refund; Domain fees non-refundable; Add-on services may be excluded

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unmetered within fair use; excessive use may require upgrade
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; non-payment; resource abuse; prohibited content
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Excessive CPU/memory usage; spam; illegal activities
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Renewal prices significantly higher than promo (up to 3x); Monthly billing not available; Domain privacy included free; Free website builder; 1 free migration included

contentRestrictions.adultContentNotes: Explicitly prohibits adult material, pornography, and erotic content
contentRestrictions.gamblingNotes: Prohibits gambling, casinos, gaming, sports betting, lottery regardless of legality

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: $45-$200 per sale; 15% on some products; $100 minimum payout; PayPal or wire transfer

editorial.knownIssues: Renewal prices significantly higher than promo rates; No monthly billing (annual minimum); Limited advanced developer features; No staging environment; Lower-tier plans restrictive (1-2 sites only); SSH access only on higher tiers; No Node.js support; Limited server locations compared to competitors
editorial.bestFor: Small businesses wanting green hosting; Beginners needing multilingual support; Users who value 24/7 phone support in multiple languages; Eco-conscious website owners; Canadian businesses wanting local hosting; SMBs needing website builder and cPanel combo
editorial.avoidIf: Need monthly billing flexibility; Developer requiring SSH on basic plan; Want staging environments; Need Node.js support; Budget-sensitive at renewal time; Need many global server locations; Require PCI/HIPAA compliance
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: One of few genuinely green hosts (100% renewable energy); Strong Trustpilot (4.7) among best in industry; A+ BBB rating; Multilingual support in 4 languages (unlike English-only competitors); cPanel included; Renewal markup significant but less than Bluehost/Hostinger; Free domain privacy (unlike GoDaddy); Limited to 6 server locations vs competitors with 10+

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: 100% green energy hosting with multilingual support in 4 languages and A+ BBB rating
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Eco-conscious small business owner wanting reliable support and beginner-friendly features

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: HostPapa is excellent for small businesses and beginners wanting green hosting with multilingual support. They have strong Trustpilot (4.7) and A+ BBB ratings, though renewal prices are higher than promo rates.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: HostPapa is a privately-owned Canadian company founded by Jamie Opalchuk in 2006. Headquartered in Burlington, Ontario. In August 2025, they acquired CloudBlue from Ingram Micro.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: HostPapa shared hosting starts at $2.95/month (promo) and renews at $8.99/month. VPS starts at $19.99/month. Annual billing minimum required.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, HostPapa is very beginner-friendly with cPanel, website builder, one-click WordPress installation, and 24/7 multilingual support via phone, chat, and ticket.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, 100 email accounts included on the Starter plan with webmail access and spam filtering.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, HostPapa offers optimized WordPress hosting with automatic installation and updates, though no staging environment is available.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: HostPapa guarantees 99.9% uptime with SLA credits if uptime falls below this threshold.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: HostPapa offers a 30-day money-back guarantee. However, only annual billing is available (no monthly plans), so cancellation after 30 days means forfeiting remaining term payment.
